recommendations.common_cold: Rest, drink fluids, and use OTC cold remedies. Consider saline nasal sprays. Seek care if symptoms last >10 days.
recommendations.influenza (flu): Antiviral medications may help if started within 48 hours. Stay hydrated and monitor breathing. Get annual flu vaccine.
recommendations.allergic rhinitis: Try antihistamines (loratadine, cetirizine) and nasal corticosteroids. Identify and avoid triggers.
recommendations.strep throat: Requires antibiotic treatment. See doctor for rapid strep test. Contagious until 24hrs after antibiotics.
recommendations.migraine: Rest in dark, quiet room. NSAIDs may help mild cases. Triptans for moderate-severe. Track triggers.
recommendations.COVID-19: Isolate immediately and get tested. Use pulse oximeter to monitor oxygen levels. Seek ER if SpO2 <92%.
recommendations.sinus infection: Try nasal irrigation and decongestants. Antibiotics may be needed if bacterial. Steam inhalation helps.
recommendations.bronchitis: Increase fluid intake. Use humidifier. OTC cough suppressants at night. Avoid smoke/dust.
recommendations.pneumonia: Requires medical evaluation. Bacterial pneumonia needs antibiotics. Hospitalization may be needed.
recommendations.gastroenteritis: Stay hydrated with electrolyte solutions. BRAT diet (bananas, rice, applesauce, toast). Seek care for blood in stool.
